newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.
newsitem.headline: Singapore government securities end narrowly mixed.

text.p: Singapore government securities ended narrowly mixed in moderate trade on interbank and retail interest, dealers said on Wednesday.

"Government securities were narrowly mixed amid uncertainty over the near-term direction of the market. Treasury bill yields were steady to slightly lower but bond prices were steady to slightly higher. Volume was moderate," a local dealer said.
In treasury bills, three-months closed at a yield of 1.55/1.50 percent compared with Tuesday's yield of 1.58/1.53 percent but one-year was unchanged from Tuesday's yield of 1.68/1.63 percent.
Among bonds, April 1999 was unchanged from Tuesday's close of S$99.53/99.58.
September 2001 ended at S$96.75/96.80 against Tuesday's S$96.70/96.75 and June 2003 at S$94.78/94.83 versus S$94.75/94.80.
The interbank rate was unchanged from Tuesday's 3-5/8 3-1/2 percent.
